Two Oruguitas|by Sebasti\u00e1n\u00a0Yat.fact: “Two Oruguitas” is the English version of “Dos Oruguitas”, the Spanish song in Encanto that represents the story of how Mirabel’s grandparents met – and eventually had to separate. It plays in the end credits of the movie.

Abre Tus Ojos|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fullTitle: Abre Tus Ojos by Germaine Franco
Abre Tus Ojos|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: Abre Tus Ojos
Abre Tus Ojos|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental score plays during the opening sequence of the film, where Abuela Alma tells a young Mirabel the story of the miracle on the night in which she is to receive her gift.

Meet La Familia|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fullTitle: Meet La Familia by Germaine Franco
Meet La Familia|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: Meet La Familia
Meet La Familia|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This score plays as The Madrigal Family prepares the home for the gift ceremony. We meet the family as each one uses their unique gift to help around the home. For example, Camilo shape shifts to help hang a banner, Isabela decorates the place with flowers, and Luisa moves heavy objects around.

I Need You|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fullTitle: I Need You by Germaine Franco
I Need You|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: I Need You
I Need You|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental song plays during Antonio’s gift ceremony. Antonio, Mirabel’s youngest cousin who she shared a room with, is a shy 5-year old who must publicly walk down the courtyard of his family’s home and up the stairs to be granted his gift. When he is unable to walk up alone, he reaches out to Mirabel and says, “I need you.” Mirabel then joins him, walks with him, and is there to witness him receiving his gift.

Antonio\u2019s Voice|by Germaine\u00a0Fr.title: Antonio’s Voice
Antonio\u2019s Voice|by Germaine\u00a0Fr.fact: Antonio is the youngest Madrigal who receives his gift during the film. This song is his theme that plays during his ceremony when he receives his gift of speaking to animals. You can hear some cantadoras singing on this track. Producer Germaine Franco shared,

El Baile Madrigal|by Germaine\u00a0Franc.fullTitle: El Baile Madrigal by Germaine Franco
El Baile Madrigal|by Germaine\u00a0Franc.title: El Baile Madrigal
El Baile Madrigal|by Germaine\u00a0Franc.fact: This upbeat instrumental plays as the community dances in Antonio’s new room, in celebration of his new gift.

The Cracks Emerge|by Germaine\u00a0Franc.fullTitle: The Cracks Emerge by Germaine Franco
The Cracks Emerge|by Germaine\u00a0Franc.title: The Cracks Emerge
The Cracks Emerge|by Germaine\u00a0Franc.fact: This instrumental plays in the score after Mirabel finishes singing “Waiting on a Miracle”. The house rumble, a tile falls from the roof and Mirabel cuts her hand picking it up. Then, cracks emerge all throughout the home, threatening the foundation and the candle.

Tenacious Mirabel|by Germaine\u00a0Franc.title: Tenacious Mirabel
Tenacious Mirabel|by Germaine\u00a0Franc.fact: This instrumental plays during the score as Mirabel is restless wondering about the cracks she saw emerging in their home. She walks across her family’s roof towards the candle, and hears Abuela Alma worrying about the miracle being threatened. Mirabel then decides she must save the miracle.

Breakfast Questions|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.title: Breakfast Questions
Breakfast Questions|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.fact: This instrumental plays during the score during the Madrigal family breakfast the morning after Antonio’s gift ceremony. During breakfast, Mirabel questions her cousin Dolores and sister Luisa about the cracks she saw in their home the night before.

Bruno's Tower|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: Bruno's Tower
Bruno's Tower|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental plays in the score after “Surface Pressure”, when Luisa tells Mirabel to find Bruno’s vision. Mirabel then sneaks into Bruno’s room.

Mirabel's Discovery|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.title: Mirabel's Discovery
Mirabel's Discovery|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.fact: This instrumental plays during the score as Mirabel looks for Bruno’s vision in the tower. She discovers a broken pieces of greenish glass under sand, and pieces them together to find an image of her. The tower begins crumbling, threatening Mirabel’s safety. She escapes, but not before finding each piece of the puzzle so she may discover Bruno’s vision.

The Dysfunctional Tango|by Germaine\u00a.fullTitle: The Dysfunctional Tango by Germaine Franco
The Dysfunctional Tango|by Germaine\u00a.title: The Dysfunctional Tango
The Dysfunctional Tango|by Germaine\u00a.fact: This tango plays as tension grows in the Madrigal family. Mirabel has just discovered the secret of Bruno’s vision foretelling Mirabel playing a role in making or breaking the magic of Encanto. Augustin, Mirabel’s father, asks Mirabel not to tell anyone this secret. However, Mirabel’s cousin Dolores, who has the gift of super hearing, overhears the secret and struggles to keep it to herself during a family dinner where Isabela is expected to be proposed to by Mariano. This song plays as the secret is whispered down the dinner table between each family member. Chaos assumes, revealing their dysfunctional family, ultimately upsetting family matriarch Abuela Alma and ruining Isabel'a engagement.

Chasing The Past|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fullTitle: Chasing The Past by Germaine Franco
Chasing The Past|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: Chasing The Past
Chasing The Past|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental plays as Mirabel looks for her uncle Bruno, who disappeared some time ago and has the gift of prophecy. She follows some rats to find a hidden entrance that leads inside the walls of the Casita. She encounters dangers on her quest to get answers and save the magic.

Family Allies|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: Family Allies
Family Allies|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental plays as Mirabel discovers the unfinished part of her home behind the walls. There, she finds and chases her uncle Bruno – who, as she will discover, went into hiding to protect his niece’s reputation.

The Ultimate Vision|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.fullTitle: The Ultimate Vision by Germaine Franco
The Ultimate Vision|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.title: The Ultimate Vision
The Ultimate Vision|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.fact: This instrumental song plays after Mirabel asked her uncle Bruno to have a vision. She wants to know more about how she can save the magic. Bruno agrees and has the vision, but the result disappoints Mirabel as the vision involves her embracing her sister who she doesn’t always get along with.

Isabela La Perfecta|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.fullTitle: Isabela La Perfecta by Germaine Franco
Isabela La Perfecta|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.title: Isabela La Perfecta
Isabela La Perfecta|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.fact: This song plays during Mirabel’s mission to hug her sister in order to save the magic of Encanto. She enters her sister Isabela’s room and attempts to apologize.

Las Hermanas Pelean|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.fullTitle: Las Hermanas Pelean by Germaine Franco
Las Hermanas Pelean|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.title: Las Hermanas Pelean
Las Hermanas Pelean|by Germaine\u00a0Fra.fact: The song’s Spanish title translates into English is “The Sisters Fight”. Mirabel’s attempt to apologize to Isabela and hug her, for the sake of saving the magic, goes awry. The song is a tango, the same musical style of a prior song in Encanto’s soundtrack “The Dysfunctional Family”, played when Mirabel ruins Isabela’s engagement.

The House Knows|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fullTitle: The House Knows by Germaine Franco
The House Knows|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: The House Knows
The House Knows|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental song plays as dysfunction in the Madrigal family continues. Mirabel confronts Abuela, saying that nobody in the family will be good enough for her and attributing her as the reason for the house breaking. During this confrontation as the song tension grows, the house is cracking.

La Candela|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: La Candela
La Candela|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental plays to emphasize conflict as the house foundation crumbles, putting the candle in danger of going out and disappearing the magic. Camilo, Isabela, and Mirabel all attempt to save the candle, but only Mirabel is able to grab it in her reach. She risks her life holding the candle as the house crumbles around her. While Mirabel is safe, the flame ends up extinguishing in her hands.

El R\u00edo|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: El Río
El R\u00edo|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental plays after “Dos Oruguitas”, where Mirabel and Abuela Alma have a heart-to-heart conversation at the river. Mirabel comes to understand that Abuela Alma’s motives were to protect their home and family after going through immense suffering alone when her husband died.

It Was Me|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fullTitle: It Was Me by Germaine Franco
It Was Me|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: It Was Me
It Was Me|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental plays after Bruno comes to his niece Mirabel’s rescue meanwhile she and Abuela are talking at the river. He anticipates that Abuela is scorning Mirabel for the destruction of their home and takes the blame to protect Mirabel. Bruno doesn’t expect the warm reaction he receives from his mom, Abuela Alma. The instrumental plays as the three then ride the horse together to return home to their family.

El Camino De Mirabel|by Germaine\u00a0Fr.fullTitle: El Camino De Mirabel by Germaine Franco
El Camino De Mirabel|by Germaine\u00a0Fr.title: El Camino De Mirabel
El Camino De Mirabel|by Germaine\u00a0Fr.fact: This instrumental plays as the last song from the score during the credits after “Mirabel’s Cumbia”.

Mirabel's Cumbia|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: Mirabel's Cumbia
Mirabel's Cumbia|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fact: This instrumental plays during the credits after “Two Oruguitas”.

The Rat's Lair|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.fullTitle: The Rat's Lair by Germaine Franco
The Rat's Lair|by Germaine\u00a0Franco.title: The Rat's Lair

Impresiones Del Encanto|by Germaine\u00a.fullTitle: Impresiones Del Encanto by Germaine Franco
Impresiones Del Encanto|by Germaine\u00a.title: Impresiones Del Encanto

La Cumbia de Mirabel|by Germaine\u00a0Fr.title: La Cumbia de Mirabel

The Family Madrigal|Instrumental by Lin-.title: The Family Madrigal

Waiting On A Miracle|Instrumental by Lin.title: Waiting On A Miracle

Surface Pressure|Instrumental by Lin-Man.title: Surface Pressure
Surface Pressure|Instrumental by Lin-Man.fact: This instrumental version of Luisa’s solo “Surface Pressure” is not included in the movie but can only be found in the soundtrack.

We Don\u2019t Talk About Bruno|Instrumen.title: We Don’t Talk About Bruno

What Else Can I Do?|Instrumental by Lin-.title: What Else Can I Do?
What Else Can I Do?|Instrumental by Lin-.fact: This instrumental version of Isabela’s song “What Else Can I Do?” is not included in the movie but can only be found in the soundtrack.

Dos Oruguitas|Instrumental by Lin-Manuel.fact: This instrumental version of “Dos Orguitas” (and “Two Oruguitas”) is not included in the movie but can only be found in the soundtrack.

Colombia, Mi Encanto|Instrumental by Lin.fact: This instrumental version of “Colombia, Mi Encanto” is not included in the movie but can only be found in the soundtrack.

Remember Me|Ernesto de la Cruz by Benjam.fact: This song appears in the Pixar movie, Coco as the signature hit for Mexican music and movie star Ernesto de la Cruz (voiced by Benjamin Bratt). The crash heard at the end of the song is Ernesto suffering an untimely death in a stage accident while performing the song.

Much Needed Advice|by Benjamin\u00a0Brat.lyrics: [Spoken: Ernesto de la Cruz]I have to sing, I have to play!The music, it's, it's not just in me it is me.When life gets me down, I play my guitar.The rest of the world may follow the rules, but I must follow my heart.You know that feeling? Like there's a song in the air and it's playing just for you?[Ernesto de la Cruz]A feeling close you can reach out and touch itI never knew I could want something so much, but it's true[Spoken: Ernesto de la Cruz, Woman]You must have faith, sister.Oh, but Padre, he will never listenHe will listen to music.[Ernesto de la Cruz]Only a song, only a song, has the power to change a heart[Spoken: Ernesto de la Cruz, Woman]Never underestimate the power of musicBut my father, he will never give me permission!I am done asking permission. When you see your moment, you mustn't let it pass you by, you must seize it.[Spoken: Ernesto de la Cruz, Interviewer]Señor de la Cruz, what did it take for you to seize your moment?I've had to have faith in my dream. No one was going to hand it to me, it was up to me reach for that dream, grab it tight...[Spoken: Miguel & Ernesto de la Cruz]...and make it come true.
Much Needed Advice|by Benjamin\u00a0Brat.fact: Miguel is hiding with his memorial to Ernesto de la Cruz, which has many pieces of memorabilia to Cruz. Miguel watches a VHS tape, titled “Best of De La Cruz,” that includes several of his favorite pieces of footage taken of Cruz. During this scene, Miguel held the guitar he had made and tried to mimic Cruz’s guitar playing, showing to the audience how he learned to play music.

Everyone Knows Juanita|by Gael\u00a0Garc.fact: Before Chicharrón (voiced by Edward James Olmos) fades from the afterlife because everyone who knew him has died or forgotten him, he requests that Hector (voiced by Gael Garcia Bernal) sing him his favorite song. Hector picks up Chicharrón’s guitar and plays this. Afterwards, Chicharrón fades to “Final Death”.

Un Poco Loco|by Anthony\u00a0Gonzalez &.fact:
“Un Poco Loco” is the song sung by Miguel at a competition he entered. The winner of the competition would be granted an opportunity to go to Ernesto de la Cruz’s concert. Miguel planned to sing “Remember Me” but Hector pointed out that many of the other contestants would be singing the same song, so Miguel decided to sing “Un Poco Loco” instead.

Lee Unkrich said on Twitter that the song was originally supposed to be a song that Hector wrote for his wife Imelda.

Remember Me|(Lullaby) by\u00a0Gael\u00a0.fact: In a flashback, Hector (Gael Garcia Bernal) sings “Remember Me” as a lullaby to his daughter Coco, Miguel’s great grandmother, before leaving to tour with Ernesto de la Cruz. This reveals that it was Hector who wrote de la Cruz’s hit song, and also reveals that Hector is in fact Miguel’s great-great grandfather, not Ernesto de la Cruz.

Proud Coraz\u00f3n|by Anthony\u00a0Gonza.fact: This song wraps up the film as it is played over the final reunion scene and happy ending. It reiterates some of the film’s messages: that family should love and support each other no matter what, and that one should be proud to be a part of a large loving family.

Remember Me|D\u00fao by Miguel.fact: This is the pop version of “Remember Me” performed as a duet by American singer, Miguel and Mexican singer, Natalia Lafourcade. This version of the song is featured during the end credits of the movie. The song was also performed during the 90th Academy Awards ceremony where it also won the award for “Best Original Song”.

Reception At The Palace / So This Is Lov.fact: At the ball, Cinderella and the Prince fall deeply in love. The music slows from a quick, brightly waltz, into a deep and ethereal song that drifts gently. A montage of the couple dancing across the palace gardens shows their love developing.

Prologue - Beauty and the Beast|by Alan\.fullTitle: Prologue - Beauty and the Beast by Alan Menken (Ft. David Ogden Stiers)
Prologue - Beauty and the Beast|by Alan\.title: Prologue - Beauty and the Beast
Prologue - Beauty and the Beast|by Alan\.lyrics: [NARRATOR, spoken]Once upon a time, in a faraway land, a young Prince lived in a shining castle. Although he had everything his heart desired, the Prince was spoiled, selfish, and unkindBut then, one winter's night, an old beggar woman came to the castle and offered him a single rose in return for shelter from the bitter cold. Repulsed by her haggard appearance, the Prince sneered at the gift and turned the old woman away. But she warned him not to be deceived by appearances, for beauty is found within. And when he dismissed her again, the old woman's ugliness melted away to reveal a beautiful enchantressThe Prince tried to apologize, but it was too late, for she had seen that there was no love in his heart. And as punishment, she transformed him into a hideous Beast and placed a powerful spell on the castle and all who lived thereAshamed of his monstrous form, the Beast concealed himself inside his castle, with a magic mirror as his only window to the outside worldThe rose she had offered was truly an enchanted rose, which would bloom until his twenty-first year. If he could learn to love another and earn their love in return by the time the last petal fell, then the spell would be broken. If not, he would be doomed to remain a Beast for all timeAs the years passed, he fell into despair and lost all hopeFor who could ever learn to love a Beast?
Prologue - Beauty and the Beast|by Alan\.fact: It’s the music of Saint-Saëns. I’m basically doing homages to all kinds of French music, and that’s my way of bringing us into that world subtly.

Belle|by Paige\u00a0O\u2019Hara, Richard.fact: One of the first songs from the 1991 Disney animated film Beauty and the Beast. “Belle” is a large-scale operetta-style musical number that introduces the film’s book-loving heroine Belle, a non-conforming young woman who has grown weary of the provincial village life that she is being forced to live, and Gaston who desires her hand in marriage.

Belle|Reprise by Paige\u00a0O'Hara.fact: The aftermath of Gaston’s attempted proposal to Belle — Belle rejects Gaston, and he stomps away. Belle then sings about how she wants more adventure instead of being and quote ‘the wife of that boorish, brainless’.

Be Our Guest|by Angela\u00a0Lansbury, Je.fact: “Be Our Guest” is the showstopping number from Disney’s 1991 animated film Beauty and the Beast. The song is sung by the enchanted castle’s residents, who welcome Belle and are excited to serve a guest after years without visitors.

Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 1|by Alan\u00a.fullTitle: Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 1 by Alan Menken
Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 1|by Alan\u00a.title: Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 1
Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 1|by Alan\u00a.lyrics: [NARRATOR]Once upon a time, in the hidden heart of France, a handsome young prince lived in a beautiful castle.​Although he had everything his heart desired, the prince was selfish and unkind.​[COGSWORTH, spoken]Master, it's time!He taxed the village to fill his castle with most beautiful objects—[LUMIERE, spoken]Oui, maître—and his parties with the most beautiful people.​

Aria|by Audra\u00a0McDonald.lyrics: [MADAME DE GARDEROBE]Oh, how divineGlamour, music, and magic combineSee the maidens so anxious to shineLook for a sign that enhances chancesShe'll be his special oneWhat a displayWhat a breathtaking, thrilling arrayEvery prince, every dog has his dayAnd I'll sing with passion, gusto, fit to bustOh, not a care in the world!
Aria|by Audra\u00a0McDonald.fact: To replace the tinted glass opening from the original film, the remake includes a new song that takes place during a ball. Madame De Garderobe sings the song during said ball but is interrupted by the knocks of the Enchantress.

Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 2|by Alan\u00a.fullTitle: Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 2 by Alan Menken
Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 2|by Alan\u00a.title: Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 2
Main Title: Prologue, Pt. 2|by Alan\u00a.lyrics: [NARRATOR, spoken]Then one night, an unexpected intruder arrived to the castle, seeking shelter from the bitter storm. As a gift, she offered the prince a single rose.​Repulsed by her haggard appearance, the prince turned the woman away... But she warned him not to be deceived by appearances... For beauty is found within. When he dismissed her again, the old woman's outer appearance melted away to reveal a beautiful enchantress.​The prince begged for forgiveness, but it was too late. For she had seen that there was no love in his heart.​As punishment, she transformed him into a hideous beast and placed a powerful spell on the castle and all who lived there.​As day bled into years, the prince and his servants were forgotten by the world, for the enchantress had erased all memory of them from the minds of the people they loved.​But the rose she had offered was truly an enchanted rose. If he could learn to love another and earn their love in return by the time the last petal fell, the spell would be broken. If not, he would be doomed to remain a beast for all time.​As the years passed, he felt into despair and lost all hope, for who could ever learn to love a beast?

Belle|by Emma\u00a0Watson.fact: This version of “Belle” is from the 2017 live action adaptation of Disney’s 1991 classic animated film “Beauty and the Beast”. This version stars Emma Watson singing as Belle and has a few different lyrics and speaking segments compared to the one for the animated film.

How Does a Moment Last Forever|Music Box.fact: “How Does a Moment Last Forever” is sung by Maurice, Belle’s father, while he is building a music box of their old home in Paris. The song is a new addition to the film, not in the animated version or Broadway show.

Belle|Reprise by Emma\u00a0Watson.fact: While in the original film the song takes place after a disastrous marriage proposal by Gaston, in the 2017 film version he only merely mentions marriage (much to Belle’s dismay) and basically harasses her. It also doesn’t take place in a stable in the new version, instead taking place in Belle’s house (and then on the hill outside of the town).

Gaston|by Josh\u00a0Gad.fact: “Gaston” is sung by the Gaston’s sidekick, LeFou, in order to cheer him up after being rejected by Belle.  Throughout the song, LeFou boasts about Gaston’s greatness and gets the entire crowd to join in about how much they admire him. At first, Gaston is annoyed by LeFou’s attempts, but after a sequence where he recreates his battle victories with the men in the tavern, he regains his confidence.

Be Our Guest|by Ewan\u00a0McGregor.fact: What could be better than dinner and a song? Prior to this song, Belle has entered the castle, met the Beast, and refused to eat dinner with him. The others, taking pity on her and trying to welcome her to her new life, prepare her an extravagant dinner, complete with entertainment.

How Does a Moment Last Forever|Montmartr.fact: This reprise of “How Does a Moment Last Forever” is sung by Belle when the Beast takes her to her childhood home in Montmartre, the highest part of Paris. The song is Belle’s reaction to visiting a painful part of her family history, which her father does not like to talk about.

Beauty and the Beast|by Emma\u00a0Thomps.fact: “Beauty and the Beast” is a song written by lyricist Howard Ashman and composer Alan Menken for the Disney animated feature film Beauty and the Beast (1991). The film’s theme song, the Broadway-inspired ballad was originally recorded by British-American actress Angela Lansbury in her role as the voice of the character Mrs. Potts, and subsequently also featured in the 2017 live-action adaptation sung by Emma Thompson as Mrs. Potts.

Aria - Demo|by Alan\u00a0Menken.fact:
The song Aria takes place during a party before the Enchantress' spell.

The demo version of it is played on the piano and sung by Alan Menken, the composer of the soundtrack, and has a slightly different lyrics.

Days in the Sun - Demo|by Alan\u00a0Menk.fact: This is a demo version of the song, “Days in the Sun” that appears in Disney’s 2017 adaption of “Beauty and the Beast.” It is written by Tim Rice, who returns as the lyricist from the Broadway musical. It is sung by Alan Menken, the composer for both the 2017 and 1991 versions of the film. Whereas the final song is sung by the young prince and the castle staff, the original version was conceived as being sung by the Beast himself. In it, the Beast expresses his regret for the careless life he lived when he was human, and longs to find true love and become human again. Like the final version of the song, “Days in the Sun” has the same melody as the “Aria” at the beginning of the film, likely to provide a contrast between the Prince’s old, selfish life and his life of remorse under the curse.

Little April Shower.fact: From the 1942 Disney movie, Bambi, based on the 1923 book, Bambi, a Life in the Woods, by Felix Salten, this song might be best appreciated along with the animation that accompany each other. In this scene, Bambi and his mother rest safely under protection from a rainstorm.

The Gospel Truth III|by Lillias\u00a0Whi.fact: “The Gospel Truth III” is about what happened after Hades' attempt to assassinate Hercules failed. As foretold that the hero would futurely ruin Hades' plans, he sent his minions Pain and Panic to kidnap the baby, feed him a potion that would turn him into a mortal and then kill him. However, he had to drink the whole potion, even the last drop of it.

Go the Distance|by Roger\u00a0Bart.fact: Young Hercules, confronted with the feeling that he belongs somewhere else, breaks out into this ballad. In the movie (which features additional dialogue and a montage), it is during this song that Hercules discovers that he was found as a baby with the symbol of Zeus around his neck, and subsequently goes to visit the Temple of Zeus.

Go the Distance|Reprise by Roger\u00a0Ba.fact: “Go the Distance” is reprised after Hercules chats with Zeus, finding out that he is his son and therefore should be living in the Mount Olympus among all the other gods. Now, the song goes through a subtle shift, going from the prior melancholic dreamer tone to a new, more exciting, hopeful and adventurous one.

One Last Hope|Soundtrack by Danny\u00a0D.fact: Hercules goes to Philoctetes to be trained, but Phil doesn’t believe Hercules is truly the son of Zeus and doesn’t want to face the pain of another failed hero. However, after some persuading from Zeus himself, Phil’s hope raises after he trains Hercules after some time through song.

I Won\u2019t Say|I\u2019m In Love by Sus.fact: From the 1997 Disney movie Hercules, “I Won’t Say (I’m In Love)” is the movie’s featured love ballad. After a romantic date with Hercules, Meg expresses her conflicting emotions through song (with some back up from the Muses). Hurt before and technically working for Herc’s arch nemesis, this song demonstrates Meg’s reluctance to get into another relationship that (in her mind) can only end badly.

Go the Distance|by Michael\u00a0Bolton.fact: Michael Bolton’s Go the Distance was a cover of the 1997 song that was written, composed, and produced by Alan Menken and David Zippel. Bolton’s was a pop version of the song that was played during the end credits of Disney’s Hercules. The version sung during the movie was by American actor Roger Bart.

Immortals|by Fall\u00a0Out Boy.fact: The 10th track of American Beauty/American Psycho, “Immortals” first appeared on the soundtrack for the 2014 Disney animated comedy superhero film Big Hero 6. Fall Out Boy was asked to create the song after learning about the movie’s plot in which a young boy loses his older brother to a super-villain. He recovers from his grief by assembling a team of super-heroes, including a robot created by his deceased brother, to apprehend the villain.

Hiro Hamada.title: Hiro Hamada
Hiro Hamada.fact: This music introduces 14-year-old Hiro Hamada (voiced by Ryan Potter) as he makes his first appearance at an illegal robot gladiator ring. His harmless-looking robot loses easily to the champion (voiced by Paul Briggs), but in a rematch, Hiro’s robot reveals its true abilities and wins, making Hiro a ton of money.

Nerd School.title: Nerd School
Nerd School.fact: Hiro (voiced by Ryan Potter) is taken by his older brother Tadashi (voiced by Daniel Henney) to see the university lab where he works. Hiro is enthralled by the technology on display.

Tadashi.title: Tadashi
Tadashi.fact: A fire and explosion at the school’s lab has tragic results, as Tadashi (voiced by Daniel Henney) and Professor Callaghan (voiced by James Cromwell) are both killed.

The Masked Man.title: The Masked Man
The Masked Man.fact: Hiro and Baymax (voiced by Ryan Potter and Scott Adsit) track Hiro’s missing microbot to an abandoned factory, where more microbots are being mass produced by a man wearing a Kabuki mask. The man sends his microbots after our heroes, who barely manage to escape.

Upgrades.title: Upgrades
Upgrades.fact: When Fred, GoGo, Wasabi, and Honey Lemon (voiced by T.J. Miller, Jamie Chung, Damon Wayans Jr., and Genesis Rodriguez) decide to team up to solve Tadashi’s murder, Hiro (voiced by Ryan Potter) decides to outfit them with armored suits that will give them all special powers.

The Streets of San Fransokyo.title: The Streets of San Fransokyo
The Streets of San Fransokyo.fact: This music plays as Hiro and his brother’s friends flee through the streets from the masked villain’s microbots. The title of the track is a reference to the 1970s TV cop show The Streets of San Francisco.

I Am Satisfied with My Care.fullTitle: I Am Satisfied with My Care
I Am Satisfied with My Care.title: I Am Satisfied with My Care
I Am Satisfied with My Care.fact: Hiro and Baymax (voiced by Ryan Potter and Scott Adsit) discover test pilot Abigail (voiced by Katie Lowes) unconscious in another dimension. As they head back to their own world, Baymax is hit by debris that damages his rocket thrusters. The only way out is for Hiro to say “I am satisfied with my care,” which will allow Baymax to disengage and save the two humans, while staying trapped in the other world. Hiro does so, leaving Baymax behind.

Reboot.title: Reboot
Reboot.fact: Upon realizing that Baymax (voiced by Scott Adsit) left his personality chip with him to take back to Earth, Hiro (voiced by Ryan Potter) is able to build another version of the robot and continue his crime-solving.

Look Through My Eyes.fact: The song, featured over the credits of Disney’s “Brother Bear” (2003), lyrically is about a person telling to another to stop fearing and looking through the first person’s eyes, as he shall discover wonderful and amazing things should the second person do it.

Welcome.fact: Two versions of the song exist. The song (whose lyrics are presented here) is performed solely by Phil Collins, but the soundtrack album also offers the movie version that also features The Blind Boys of Alabama and Oren Waters.

No Way Out|Theme from Brother Bear singl.fact: “No Way Out” is featured in the scene where Kenai is being forced to tell Koda that he killed his mother when he was a human. He is remorseful but Koda looks horrified and runs away in fear.

On My Way.lyrics: Tell everybody I'm on my wayNew friends and new places to seeWith blue skies aheadYes, I'm on my wayAnd there's nowhere else that I'd rather beTell everybody I'm on my wayAnd I'm lovin' every step I takeWith the sun beating downYes, I'm on my wayAnd I can't keep this smile off my face'Cause there's nothing like seeing each other againNo matter what the distance betweenAnd the stories that we tell will make you smileOh it really lifts my heartSo tell 'em all I'm on my wayNew friends and new places to seeAnd to sleep under the starsWho could ask for more?With the moon keeping watch over meNot the snow, not the rain, can change my mindThe sun will come out wait and seeAnd the feeling of the wind in your face can lift your heartWhoa, there's nowhere I would rather be'Cause I'm on my way nowWell and trulyI'm on my way now(whistling)(I'm on my way now)(I'm on my way now)(I'm on my way now)Tell everybody I'm on my way(I'm on my way)And I just can't wait to be there(Just can't wait to be there)With blue skies aheadYes, I'm on my wayAnd nothing but good times to shareSo tell everybody I'm on my wayAnd I just can't wait to be home(Just can't wait to be home)With the sun beating downYes, I'm on my wayAnd nothing but good times to showI'm on my wayYes, I'm on my way!
On My Way.fact: Kenai has begrudgingly accepted Koda’s idea of them travelling together to the salmon run. Koda begins to tell a story about his mother, but Kenai rudely interrupts him and says that he should save the story for his friends. Koda then decides to sing instead, which leads into this song. Kenai is initially irritated by the young cub’s enthusiasm, but as the journey progresses he slowly warms to Koda.

Welcome|by The\u00a0Blind Boys Of Alabam.fact: This song scores a scene in which Kenai and Koda arrive at the salmon run and meet with a large number of other bears. Kenai is initially hesitant to join in, but after seeing how much the other bears are enjoying themselves he soon loosens up and joins in the fun.

No Way Out|Theme from Brother Bear.fact: In the movie this song marks an emotional turning point in which Kenai admits that he killed Koda’s mother through a story that’s “… kind of about a man and kind of about a bear… but mostly it’s about a monster.”

Transformation.fact: “Transformation” is a song from the 2003 Disney film “Brother Bear”. There are two versions of this song: The film version, which was sung in Inuit Eskimo by the Bulgarian Women’s Choir, and this version, sung by Phil Collins on English.

Burnin' Love|by Wynonna.fact: This track plays over the film’s credits in celebration of the family finally becoming united. Stitch finds his family, Nani and Lilo can now be together without the fear of separation, and Jumba and Pleakley have been adopted into the family after being left on Earth. During the credits we see the family visiting Graceland, the home of Elvis Presley, of whom Lilo is a huge fan.

Hollow Knight.name: Hollow Knight
Hollow Knight.fullTitle: Hollow Knight (Original Soundtrack) by Christopher Larkin
Hollow Knight.desciption:
Beneath the fading town of Dirtmouth sleeps an ancient, forgotten kingdom. Many are drawn beneath the surface, searching for riches, or glory, or answers to old secrets. Descend into Hallownest, traverse the depths, unravel its mysteries and conquer its evils.

The score for Hollow Knight captures the vast underground world of the game. The story begins with soft piano notes echoing the Hollow Knight theme, and as the player explores further, orchestral forces swell to an operatic scale as the fate of the knight unfolds.

Slayer of hydras

Zagreus came

Devoured in pieces
From his heart aflame
The seed
Of Dionysus grew
The God of wine and feast anew
To live
At home on Olympus
Never presuming

Wrath
Of thunder and lightning
Struck down the Titans
Burned into sand
Up
From out of the ashes
Born of the Titans
The mortals did stand
To live
The model of the gods
At once divine and further flawed
In twain
The blood of immortals
Of Zagreus ending
It flows in their veins

Persona 5.name: Persona 5
Persona 5.fullTitle: Persona 5 Original Soundtrack by 目黒将司 (Shoji Meguro)
Persona 5.desciption: Persona 5 Original Soundtrack is the official soundtrack of Persona 5. It was released by Atlus on January 17, 2017. The soundtrack features 110 tracks from the game, spread into three discs. It is composed by Shoji Meguro with additional compositions by Toshiki Konishi, Kenichi Tsuchiya, Atsushi Kitajoh and Ryota Kozuka, with vocals by Lyn Inaizumi. The soundtrack album includes a booklet that contains a tracklist, lyrics to 7 vocalized tracks, track commentary and liner notes.

Undertale.name: Undertale
Undertale.desciption:
Undertale is a single-player role-playing game. Created by American Indie developer and composer Toby Fox, who has had past experience in the gaming creation format, but never had a game as widely popular as this.
Songs most known to others are Megalovania, made to express sudden harsh anger in remixed videos of it loudly playing to agitate/amuse the viewer.
There also seems to be the missing of white, fluffy puppies around here some where.. Maybe some genius will find them.

I. Dogma.title: I. Dogma
I. Dogma.lyrics:
I. Dogma Lyrics
In the first age
In the first battle
When the shadows first lengthened
One stood
He chose the path of perpetual torment
In his ravenous hatred he found no peace
And with boiling blood he scoured the umbral plains
Seeking vengeance against the dark lords who had wronged him
And those that tasted the bite of his sword named him
The Doom SlayerYou might also likeEmbed

II. Demigod.title: II. Demigod

II. Demigod Lyrics
Tempered by the fires of hell
His iron will remained steadfast through the passage
That preys upon the weak
He set forth without pity
And he hunted the slaves of doom with barbarous cruelty
Unbreakable, incorruptible, unyielding
None could stand before the horde but the Doom Slayer
For he alone was the hell walkerYou might also likeEmbed

They knew he would come

IV. Doom Lyrics
Blinded by his fervor, the lure drew him in
The priests entombed him in the cursed sarcophagus
The mark of the doom slayer was burned upon his crypt
A warning to all of hell that the terror within must never be freed
And there he lies still
Ever more
